value.title: Introducing Power BI Premium Gen2
value.excerpt: At Microsoft Ignite, we found out about Power BI Premium Gen2. It's now available for you to use and WOW! It has changed the game! Adam walks you through what the changes are to help you level up.  Docs: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-premium-what-is#power-bi-premium-generation-2-preview

value.title: Merging your data in a modern lakehouse data warehouse
value.excerpt: Learn how you can move your data through different tiers using MERGE either with pySpark or SQL in Azure Synapse Analytics. Stijn Wynants walks you through the different steps.  Stijn Wynants https://twitter.com/SQLStijn  pyspark.sql.SparkSession.createDataFrame https://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/api/python/reference/pyspark.sql/api/pyspark.sql.SparkSession.createDataFrame.html

value.title: Power BI and the On-premises Data Gateway: What is it?
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at the On-Premises Data Gateway. What is it exactly? This can be used with more than just Power BI. This includes PowerApps, Microsoft Flow, Azure Analysis Services and more. The entire Power Platform!   If you found this video helpful, we have a free cheat sheet for you for more

value.title: Power BI Apps for Consumers
value.excerpt: Adam looks at how you can use Power BI Apps as a consumer of dashboards and reports. value.title: Power BI URL Filter Updates (August 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at the recent updates to using the Power BI URL Filter. The update to using URL Filter parameters in Power BI include updates to operators along with the ability to use more than strings and spaces in table names!   Blog: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/power-bi-report-url-filter-improvements/

value.title: Power BI: Use DAX to get relative dates
value.excerpt: Patrick looks at how you can get relative dates, in Power BI Desktop, without using the relative date slicer or relative date filters. value.title: Start your Power BI journey with Guy in a Cube
value.excerpt: Want to learn Power BI from the masters?   Coming from Microsoft Excel and not sure where to start? Or, maybe you've used Power BI but want to make sure you are doing the right thing. Guy in a Cube has a course for you!  Power BI Blueprint: A step-by-step guide to creating report with Power BI.  https://guyinacu.be/courses

value.title: Using R Visuals with Power BI

value.title: ConcatenateX in Power BI and DAX   Concatenate Values of a Column
value.excerpt: It happens often in Power BI calculations and reports that you need to concatenate a list of values from a column. You can do this concatenation in Power Query or DAX. However, if the concatenation needs to be done dynamically. ConcatenateX is a very helpful DAX function to achieve such results. It is
